articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. investors were big buyers of equity funds in the seven days through Nov. 15, spurred by expectations that the Federal Reserve may pause its interest rate hikes in light of recent subdued U.S. inflation data.
articles.title: US equity funds draw heavy inflows on expectations for Fed pause

articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf
articles.description: Are U.S. stocks poised to continue their dramatic run, or is a pause ahead? That’s the question investors are asking as the S&P 500 heads into the close of the year with a fresh record high coming into view.
articles.title: Wall St Week Ahead After breathtaking surge, U.S. stocks' path may rest on economic soft landing

articles.author: Greg Bensinger
articles.description: Amazon.com (AMZN.O) on Friday announced it is trimming roles at its Alexa voice assistant unit, citing “shifting” business priorities and a greater focus on generative artificial intelligence.
articles.title: Exclusive: Amazon.com to cut 'several hundred' Alexa jobs

articles.author: David Shepardson, Nathan Gomes
articles.description: United Auto Workers (UAW) members at Ford Motor (F.N) and Chrysler parent Stellantis NV (STLAM.MI) have voted to ratify a tentative record-setting labor deal, the union's vote tracker showed on Friday.
articles.title: Ford, Stellantis workers vote to ratify new labor contract

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: Millions of "gig" workers may get missed every month in the U.S. government's employment report, a discrepancy with implications for how Federal Reserve officials size up the job market and any associated inflation risks.
articles.title: US jobs data may be miscounting millions of 'gig' workers, research suggests

articles.author: Olesya Astakhova, Alex Lawler
articles.description: OPEC+ is set to consider whether to make additional oil supply cuts when the group meets later this month, three OPEC+ sources told Reuters after prices dropped by almost 20 percent since late September.
articles.title: OPEC+ to consider whether more oil cuts needed - sources

articles.author: Leroy Leo, Khushi Mandowara
articles.description: Booming demand for newer weight-loss and diabetes drugs is expected to accelerate the rise in medical expenses for employers in the United States next year, staff health benefits consultant Mercer said on Friday.
articles.title: Boom in weight-loss drugs to drive up US employers' medical costs in 2024 - Mercer

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israeli soldiers found a tunnel shaft used by Hamas militants at Gaza's Al Shifa hospital, the army said, while the U.N. voiced concern no aid would be delivered to Palestinians on Friday via the Rafah crossing with Egypt.
articles.title: Hamas tunnel found at Gaza's Al Shifa hospital, says Israel; UN aid halted

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: Facing a likely choice between Republican Donald Trump or Democrat Joe Biden in the 2024 presidential race, many Americans are desperate for younger, less divisive options.
articles.title: Biden, Trump unpopularity buoys third party hopes for 2024 US election

articles.author: Moira Warburton, David Morgan
articles.description: Embattled U.S. Representative George Santos faced a fresh effort to expel him from Congress on Friday, the day after fellow lawmakers released a report that suggested federal prosecutors should bring additional criminal charges against him.
articles.title: US Rep. George Santos faces effort to expel him from Congress after scathing report
